moves.1. e4 c5: Great oppening for the dioagonal of the black Q.
moves.6... h6 7. Bxf6: Taking knight for bishop is my favorite.
moves.7... Qxf6: This was black's first mistake. He had his queenside open and he choose to defend with his queen.
moves.8. Nc3: Now i could open my knight without the fear of pinning by the Q.
moves.10... O-O: why not moving the Q to a5?
moves.11. g3: having my kingside ready for roke
moves.11... Nd4: this was a relief, this black pawn at e5 was quite a pressure
moves.12. Nxe5 f6: if there are two knights in the same raw is a great attack
